item.title: Run using the FIPS-140 Cryptographic Module
item.description: While KrakenD’s stateless design does not handle customer data storage, it still offers a binary that facilitates FIPS 140-3 compliance to protect customers’ data in-transit. If you are unfamiliar with FIPS, the US National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), in collaboration with the Canadian Centre for Cyber Security, released the [Cryptographic Module Validation Program][https://csrc.nist.gov/projects/cryptographic-module-validation-program] (CMVP), which validates cryptographic modules to ensure they meet security standards for Federal agencies. Still, it gained interest from other sectors and industries that started to follow the same standards.
